subject: Home & DIY
title: Food Miles vs Food Choices
description: A fast breakdown of Food Miles vs Food Choices for builders.

hook.text: Transport accounts for only 6% of food's carbon footprint. What you eat matters far more than where it comes from.

buildup.text: The 'eat local' movement assumes distance drives food emissions. Studies show farming methods dominate instead.

discovery.text: Beef produces 60x more emissions per gram of protein than peas, regardless of origin. The animal is the issue.

twist.text: Sea freight is efficient: 1 tonne shipped 10,000 km by boat emits less COâ‚‚ than driving the same load 100 km by truck.

climax.text: Dropping beef one meal a week saves more emissions than eating fully local for a year. The lever is diet, not distance.

punchline.text: What's on your plate matters more than how far it traveled.

quiz.question: What percentage of food's carbon footprint comes from transport?
